topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/550d05ad6368724e4a640000#post_550d05ad6368724e4a640000
??? I'm not going to apply, i have a bad habit of getting into off topic arguments and wouldn't be very helpful with fixing tags, which is the main thing they want people's help with,

I make mistakes, i break the rules, i forget the rules, But this is not one of those times, i saw a rule being broken realized it and asked you to fix it, i expect the same from anyone else when i do so, a small group of people work their asses off to give fans of the show a fun place to hang out, and most of their rules are simply "Don't make it un fun for other people," if we can't make that effort then we don't deserve the site,

topics.body:
"@hype":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/550d064c63687260b6090000#post_550d064c63687260b6090000
From personal experience they don't last in the long run if the site is small.  If it's say like yahoo forums or such that's another thing, but the last site I was a moderator for the site owner really wanted to add this dude that was sucking up hard to him and I kept going "Dude; no!  He'll fuck up the site's ad revenue hard!" and surprise surprise he got made a mod and by the end of the month the site lost $1500 in ad revenue cause he pissed off the advertisers by banning the advertisers in a ban happy spree.

I guess the moral of the story is: smart site owners don't choose suck ups to be moderators cause often times suck ups are fuck ups.

Tl:dr; how much someone's a suck up = how much they'll fuck up.
